party hello everyone and welcome back to another episode of JS party where every week we throw a party about JavaScript

coat is dead and the it's kind of hard to to summarize but um the idea is is
that we've started to fetishize certain aspects of clean code
and I think that in some ways we've forgotten what the part of clean coat is which is to um keep things changeable

magical clean code enchantment that we'll be able to do that will save us from that problem and the talk is mostly

mature code that is no longer changing very rapidly but dry code is also not

can be a liability right if you have very dry code that you know if you
prematurely dry out your code um and you don't know everything about what could

terms of the experience of what it feels like to work with dry code absolutely
yeah I mean if you have a pot right you can't once you try it out like you're done it's that thing forever and
sometimes that's what you want uh and one of the reasons that don't repeat yourself is great is that it it does
create as you mature a system it gets you out of this problem of oh I've got this bug in one place I have to fix it
in 10 yeah and moves down but when you are in that stage of Rapid iteration
it's painful it it can be really painful one of the misconceptions about the talk and I think something thing that I've
had to convince a couple people out of um is that I'm I have no intention of
saying that clean the practice of clean code is dead I think that there are aspects of clean code that are really

is the best what are the best rules to apply in this situation so you know dry
is really great as you said with code that is is known uh it is really good
